text:
```[ERROR] Uploading file "modules/Header.module/module.html" to "modules/Header.module/module.html" failed
[ERROR] internal error
[ERROR] line -1: 'module' is disabled in this context```
This suddenly started happening today. All other modules uploads without any trouble, so why is this one throwing errors?
Oh wait, can't include a module within a module

Thanks for joining in on this <@U22VBL87M>.  Expanding on this for the currently available functionality, if two people are both working in the same file and push their changes with `--draft mode`,  the most recent push would win out and overwrite the previous push's changes, correct?
draft mode for the PROD portal could be used as a “staging” like environment
in a team-based situation, it makes sense in many cases for a source control system like git/github to be the source of truth for a project’s code
and then for there to be a process for “deploying” the code from the main branch in the source control system to the PROD portal
ahhh okay.. that seems feasible. just requires an extra few steps to attain version control.
